   20: -module(init_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: 
   25: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   26: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   27: 
   28: -export([get_arguments/1, get_argument/1, boot_var/1, restart/1,
   29: 	 many_restarts/0, many_restarts/1, restart_with_mode/1,
   30: 	 get_plain_arguments/1, init_group_history_deadlock/1,
   31: 	 reboot/1, stop_status/1, stop/1, get_status/1, script_id/1,
   32:          dot_erlang/1, unknown_module/1,
   33: 	 find_system_processes/0]).
   34: -export([boot1/1, boot2/1]).
   35: 
   36: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   37: 
   38: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   39: %% Test suite for init. (Most code is run during system start/stop.
   40: %% Should be started in a CC view with:
   41: %% erl -sname master -rsh ctrsh
   42: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
   43: suite() ->
   44:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   45:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   46: 
   47: all() -> 
   48:     [get_arguments, get_argument, boot_var,
   49:      many_restarts, restart_with_mode,
   50:      get_plain_arguments, init_group_history_deadlock,
   51:      restart, stop_status, get_status, script_id,
   52:      dot_erlang, unknown_module, {group, boot}].
   53: 
   54: groups() -> 
   55:     [{boot, [], [boot1, boot2]}].
   56: 
   57: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   58:     Config.
   59: 
   60: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   61:     ok.
   62: 
   63: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   64:     Config.
   65: 
   66: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   67:     Config.
   68: 
   69: 
   70: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
   71:     Config.
   72: 
   73: end_per_testcase(_Func, _Config) ->
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: get_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   77:     Args = args(),
   78:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
   79:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_arguments, []) of
   80: 	Arguments when is_list(Arguments) ->
   81: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
   82: 	    check_a(Arguments),
   83: 	    check_b(Arguments),
   84: 	    check_c(Arguments),
   85: 	    check_d(Arguments);
   86: 	_ ->
   87:             peer:stop(Peer),
   88: 	    ct:fail(get_arguments)
   89:     end,
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: check_a(Args) ->
   93:     case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args) of
   94: 	{value, {a,["kalle"]}} ->
   95: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(a,1,Args),
   96: 	    case lists:keysearch(a,1,Args1) of
   97: 		false ->
   98: 		    ok;
   99: 		_ ->
  100: 		    ct:fail(check_a1)
  101: 	    end;
  102: 	_ ->
  103: 	    ct:fail(check_a2)
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: check_b(Args) ->
  107:     case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args) of
  108: 	{value, {b,["hej", "hopp"]}} ->
  109: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args),
  110: 	    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args1) of
  111: 		{value, {b,["san", "sa"]}} ->
  112: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(b,1,Args1),
  113: 		    case lists:keysearch(b,1,Args2) of
  114: 			false ->
  115: 			    ok;
  116: 			_ ->
  117: 			    ct:fail(check_b1)
  118: 		    end;
  119: 		_ ->
  120: 		    ct:fail(check_b2)
  121: 	    end;
  122: 	_ ->
  123: 	    ct:fail(check_b3)
  124:     end.
  125: 
  126: check_c(Args) ->
  127:     case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args) of
  128: 	{value, {c,["4", "5", "6"]}} ->
  129: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args),
  130: 	    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args1) of
  131: 		{value, {c,["7", "8", "9"]}} ->
  132: 		    Args2 = lists:keydelete(c,1,Args1),
  133: 		    case lists:keysearch(c,1,Args2) of
  134: 			false ->
  135: 			    ok;
  136: 			_ ->
  137: 			    ct:fail(check_c1)
  138: 		    end;
  139: 		_ ->
  140: 		    ct:fail(check_c2)
  141: 	    end;
  142: 	_ ->
  143: 	    ct:fail(check_c3)
  144:     end.
  145: 
  146: check_d(Args) ->
  147:     case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args) of
  148: 	{value, {d,[]}} ->
  149: 	    Args1 = lists:keydelete(d,1,Args),
  150: 	    case lists:keysearch(d,1,Args1) of
  151: 		false ->
  152: 		    ok;
  153: 		_ ->
  154: 		    ct:fail(check_d1)
  155: 	    end;
  156: 	_ ->
  157: 	    ct:fail(check_d2)
  158:     end.
  159: 
  160: get_argument(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  161:     Args = args(),
  162:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  163:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [b]) of
  164: 	{ok, [["hej", "hopp"],["san", "sa"]]} ->
  165: 	    ok;
  166: 	_ ->
  167: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  168: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, b})
  169:     end,
  170:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [a]) of
  171: 	{ok, [["kalle"]]} ->
  172: 	    ok;
  173: 	_ ->
  174: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  175: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, a})
  176:     end,
  177:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  178: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  179: 	    ok;
  180: 	_ ->
  181: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  182: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, c})
  183:     end,
  184:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [d]) of
  185: 	{ok, [[]]} ->
  186: 	    ok;
  187: 	_ ->
  188: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  189: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, d})
  190:     end,
  191:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [e]) of
  192: 	error ->
  193: 	    ok;
  194: 	_ ->
  195: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  196: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, e})
  197:     end,
  198:     peer:stop(Peer),
  199:     ok.
  200: 
  201: get_plain_arguments(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  202:     Longstring = 
  203: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  204: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  205: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  206: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  207: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  208: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  209: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  210: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2"
  211: 	"fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2fjdkfjdkfjfdaa2",
  212:     true = (length(Longstring) > 255),
  213:     Args = long_args(Longstring),
  214:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  215:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_plain_arguments, []) of
  216: 	["a", "b", "c", Longstring] ->
  217: 	    ok;
  218: 	As ->
  219: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  220: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, As})
  221:     end,
  222:     peer:stop(Peer),
  223: 
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: 
  227: init_group_history_deadlock(_Config) ->
  228:     Output = os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -noshell -eval \"logger:warning(\\\"testing\\\")\" "
  229:             "-inets services crashme -eval \"application:start(inets, permanent).\" "),
  230: 
  231:     io:format("Got output: ~ts~n",[Output]),
  232: 
  233:     case string:find(Output, "removed_failing_handler") of
  234:         nomatch -> ok;
  235:         _ -> ct:fail("Found unexpected printout in log")
  236:     end.
  237: 
  238: %% ------------------------------------------------
  239: %% Use -boot_var flag to set $TEST_VAR in boot script.
  240: %% ------------------------------------------------
  241: boot_var(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  242:     {BootScript, TEST_VAR, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} = create_boot(Config),
  243: 
  244:     %% Should fail as we have not given -boot_var TEST_VAR
  245:     try
  246:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => ["-boot", BootScript], connection => standard_io}),
  247:         ct:fail({boot_var, "Should not start without TEST_VAR"})
  248:     catch
  249:         exit:{boot_failed,{exit_status,1}} ->
  250:             ok
  251:     end,
  252: 
  253: 
  254:     case is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) of
  255: 	true ->
  256: 	    %% Now it should work !!
  257: 	    {ok, Peer, _} = ?CT_PEER(["-boot", BootScript, "-boot_var", "TEST_VAR", TEST_VAR]),
  258: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  259: 	    Res = ok;
  260: 	_ ->
  261: 	    %% What we need is not so much version numbers on the directories, but
  262: 	    %% for the boot var TEST_VAR to appear in the boot script, and it doesn't
  263: 	    %% if we give the 'local' option to systools:make_script.
  264: 	    io:format(
  265: 	      "Test case not complete as we are not~n"
  266: 	      "running in a real system!~n"
  267: 	      "Probably this test is performed in a "
  268: 	      "clearcase view or source tree.~n"
  269: 	      "Need version numbers on the kernel and "
  270: 	      "stdlib directories!~n",
  271: 	      []),
  272: 	    Res = {skip,
  273: 		   "Test case only partially run since it is run "
  274: 		   "in a clearcase view or in a source tree. "
  275: 		   "Need an installed system to complete this test."}
  276:     end,
  277:     Res.
  278: 
  279: create_boot(Config) ->
  280:     {ok, OldDir} = file:get_cwd(),
  281:     {LatestDir, LatestName, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn} =
  282: 	create_script(Config),
  283:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  284:     ok = file:set_cwd(LatestDir),
  285:     ok = systools:make_script(LatestName,
  286: 			      [{variables, [{"TEST_VAR", LibDir}]}]),
  287:     ok = file:set_cwd(OldDir),
  288:     {LatestDir ++ "/" ++ LatestName, LibDir, KernelVsn, StdlibVsn}.
  289: 
  290: is_real_system(KernelVsn, StdlibVsn) ->
  291:     LibDir = code:lib_dir(),
  292:     filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "kernel-"++KernelVsn)) andalso
  293: 	filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir, "stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)).
  294: 
  295: %% ------------------------------------------------
  296: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  297: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  298: %% before restart.
  299: %% ------------------------------------------------
  300: many_restarts() ->
  301:     [{timetrap,{minutes,16}}].
  302: 
  303: many_restarts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  304:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => standard_io}),
  305:     loop_restart(50,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])),
  306:     peer:stop(Peer),
  307:     ok.
  308: 
  309: loop_restart(0,_,_,_) ->
  310:     ok;
  311: loop_restart(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  312:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  313:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  314:     receive
  315: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  316: 	    ok
  317:     after 10000 ->
  318: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  319: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  320:     end,
  321:     ok = wait_for(60, Peer, Node, EHPid),
  322:     loop_restart(N-1,Peer,Node,rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[logger])).
  323: 
  324: wait_for(0,Peer,_Node,_) ->
  325:     peer:stop(Peer),
  326:     error;
  327: wait_for(N,Peer,Node,EHPid) ->
  328:     case rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [logger]) of
  329: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid), Pid =/= EHPid ->
  330: 	    %% erlang:display(ok),
  331: 	    ok;
  332: 	_X ->
  333: 	    %% erlang:display(_X),
  334: 	    %% Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  335: 	    %% erlang:display(Procs),
  336: 	    %% case is_list(Procs) of
  337: 	    %%     true ->
  338: 	    %% 	  [(catch erlang:display(
  339: 	    %% 			  rpc:call(Node,
  340: 	    %% 				   erlang,
  341: 	    %% 				   process_info,
  342: 	    %% 				   [Y,registered_name])))
  343: 	    %% 		 || Y <- Procs];
  344: 	    %%     _ ->
  345: 	    %% 	  ok
  346: 	    %% end,
  347: 	    receive
  348: 	    after 100 ->
  349: 		    ok
  350: 	    end,
  351: 	    wait_for(N-1,Peer,Node,EHPid)
  352:     end.
  353: 
  354: restart_with_mode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     %% We cannot use loose_node because it doesn't run in
  356:     %% embedded mode so we quickly start one that exits after restarting
  357:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  358: 
  359:     Quote = case os:type() of
  360:                 {win32,_} ->
  361:                     [$"];
  362:                 {unix,_} ->
  363:                     [$']
  364:             end,
  365: 
  366:     Eval1 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of interactive -> init:restart([{mode,embedded}]); embedded -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  367:     Cmd1 = Erl ++ " -mode interactive -noshell -eval " ++ Eval1,
  368:     "interactiveembedded" = os:cmd(Cmd1),
  369: 
  370:     Eval2 = Quote ++ "Mode=code:get_mode(), io:fwrite(Mode), case Mode of embedded -> init:restart([{mode,interactive}]); interactive -> erlang:halt() end" ++ Quote,
  371:     Cmd2 = Erl ++ " -mode embedded -noshell -eval " ++ Eval2,
  372:     "embeddedinteractive" = os:cmd(Cmd2),
  373: 
  374:     ok.
  375: 
  376: %% ------------------------------------------------
  377: %% Slave executes erlang:halt() on master nodedown.
  378: %% Therefore the slave process must be killed
  379: %% before restart.
  380: %% ------------------------------------------------
  381: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  382:     Args = args(),
  383:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args, connection => standard_io}),
  384:     %% Ok, the node is up, now the real test test begins.
  385:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  386:     SysProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  387:     io:format("SysProcs0=~p~n", [SysProcs0]),
  388:     [InitPid, PurgerPid, LitCollectorPid,
  389:      DirtySigNPid, DirtySigHPid, DirtySigMPid,
  390:      PrimFilePid,
  391:      ESockRegPid] = SysProcs0,
  392:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  393:     PurgerPid = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  394:     Procs = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  395:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  396:     MaxPid = lists:last(Procs),
  397:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, restart, []),
  398:     receive
  399: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  400: 	    ok
  401:     after 10000 ->
  402: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  403: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  404:     end,
  405:     ok = wait_restart(30, Node),
  406: 
  407:     SysProcs1 = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, find_system_processes, []),
  408:     io:format("SysProcs1=~p~n", [SysProcs1]),
  409:     [InitPid1, PurgerPid1, LitCollectorPid1,
  410:      DirtySigNPid1, DirtySigHPid1, DirtySigMPid1,
  411:      PrimFilePid1,
  412:      ESockRegPid1] = SysProcs1,
  413: 
  414:     %% Still the same init process!
  415:     InitPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [init]),
  416:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid),
  417:     InitP = pid_to_list(InitPid1),
  418: 
  419:     %% and same purger process!
  420:     PurgerPid1 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [erts_code_purger]),
  421:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid),
  422:     PurgerP = pid_to_list(PurgerPid1),
  423: 
  424:     %% and same literal area collector process!
  425:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid),
  426:     LitCollectorP = pid_to_list(LitCollectorPid1),
  427: 
  428:     %% and same normal dirty signal handler process!
  429:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid),
  430:     DirtySigNP = pid_to_list(DirtySigNPid1),
  431:     %% and same high dirty signal handler process!
  432:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid),
  433:     DirtySigHP = pid_to_list(DirtySigHPid1),
  434:     %% and same max dirty signal handler process!
  435:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid),
  436:     DirtySigMP = pid_to_list(DirtySigMPid1),
  437: 
  438:     %% and same prim_file helper process!
  439:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid),
  440:     PrimFileP = pid_to_list(PrimFilePid1),
  441: 
  442:     %% and same socket_registry helper process!
  443:     if ESockRegPid =:= undefined, ESockRegPid1 =:= undefined ->
  444:             %% No socket registry on either node
  445:             ok;
  446:        true ->
  447:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid),
  448:             ESockRegP = pid_to_list(ESockRegPid1)
  449:     end,
  450: 
  451:     NewProcs0 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, processes, []),
  452:     NewProcs = NewProcs0 -- SysProcs1,
  453:     case check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) of
  454: 	true ->
  455: 	    ok;
  456: 	_ ->
  457: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  458: 	    ct:fail(processes_not_greater)
  459:     end,
  460: 
  461:     %% Check that socket tables has been re-initialized; check one
  462:     MsgFlags = fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node),
  463: 
  464:     %% Test that, for instance, the same argument still exists.
  465:     case rpc:call(Node, init, get_argument, [c]) of
  466: 	{ok, [["4", "5", "6"], ["7", "8", "9"]]} ->
  467: 	    ok;
  468: 	_ ->
  469: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  470: 	    ct:fail({get_argument, restart_fail})
  471:     end,
  472:     peer:stop(Peer),
  473:     ok.
  474: 
  475: -record(sys_procs, {init,
  476: 		    code_purger,
  477: 		    literal_collector,
  478: 		    dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  479: 		    dirty_sig_handler_high,
  480: 		    dirty_sig_handler_max,
  481:                     prim_file,
  482:                     socket_registry}).
  483: 
  484: find_system_processes() ->
  485:     find_system_procs(processes(), #sys_procs{}).
  486: 
  487: find_system_procs([], SysProcs) ->
  488:     [SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  489:      SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  490:      SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  491:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  492:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  493:      SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  494:      SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  495:      SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry];
  496: find_system_procs([P|Ps], SysProcs) ->
  497:     case process_info(P, [initial_call, priority]) of
  498: 	[{initial_call,{erl_init,start,2}},_] ->
  499: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.init,
  500: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{init = P});
  501: 	[{initial_call,{erts_code_purger,start,0}},_] ->
  502: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.code_purger,
  503: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{code_purger = P});
  504: 	[{initial_call,{erts_literal_area_collector,start,0}},_] ->
  505: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.literal_collector,
  506: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{literal_collector = P});
  507: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  508:          {priority,normal}] ->
  509: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_normal,
  510: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_normal = P});
  511: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  512:                        {priority,high}] ->
  513: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_high,
  514: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_high = P});
  515: 	[{initial_call,{erts_dirty_process_signal_handler,start,0}},
  516:          {priority,max}] ->
  517: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.dirty_sig_handler_max,
  518: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{dirty_sig_handler_max = P});
  519:         [{initial_call,{prim_file,start,0}},_] ->
  520: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.prim_file,
  521: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{prim_file = P});
  522:         [{initial_call,{socket_registry,start,0}},_] ->
  523: 	    undefined = SysProcs#sys_procs.socket_registry,
  524: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs#sys_procs{socket_registry = P});
  525: 	_ ->
  526: 	    find_system_procs(Ps, SysProcs)
  527:     end.
  528: 
  529: wait_restart(0, _Node) ->
  530:     ct:fail(not_restarted);
  531: wait_restart(N, Node) ->
  532:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  533: 	pong -> ok;
  534: 	_ -> 
  535: 	    ct:sleep(1000),
  536: 	    wait_restart(N - 1, Node)
  537:     end.
  538: 
  539: check_processes(NewProcs, MaxPid) ->
  540:     [N,P,I] = apid(MaxPid),
  541:     case lists:filter(fun(Pid) ->
  542: 			      case apid(Pid) of
  543: 				  [N,P1,_I1] when P1 > P -> false;
  544: 				  [N,_P1,I1] when I1 > I -> false;
  545: 				  _                      -> true
  546: 			      end
  547: 		      end, NewProcs) of
  548: 	[] ->
  549: 	    true;
  550: 	_  ->
  551: 	    false
  552:     end.
  553: 
  554: apid(Pid) ->
  555:     [N,P,I] = string:tokens(pid_to_list(Pid),"<>."),
  556:     [list_to_integer(N),list_to_integer(P),list_to_integer(I)].
  557: 
  558: fetch_socket_msg_flags(Node) ->
  559:     case code:is_loaded(prim_socket) of
  560:         {file,preloaded} ->
  561:             lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, socket, supports, [msg_flags]));
  562:         _ ->
  563:             ok
  564:     end.
  565: 
  566: %% ------------------------------------------------
  567: %% Just test that the system is halted here.
  568: %% The reboot facility using heart is tested
  569: %% in the heart_SUITE.
  570: %% ------------------------------------------------
  571: reboot(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  572:     Args = args(),
  573:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  574:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  575:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  576:     receive
  577: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  578: 	    ok
  579:     after 10000 ->
  580: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  581: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  582:     end,
  583:     ct:sleep(5000),
  584:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  585: 	pang ->
  586: 	    ok;
  587: 	_ ->
  588: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  589: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  590:     end,
  591:     ok.
  592: 
  593: %% ------------------------------------------------
  594: %%
  595: %% ------------------------------------------------
  596: stop_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  597:     badarg = catch_stop([65,[66],67]),  % flat strings only
  598:     badarg = catch_stop([65, 666, 67]),  % only bytes in string
  599:     badarg = catch_stop(abort),  % 'abort' not allowed
  600:     badarg = catch_stop(true),  % other atoms not allowed
  601:     badarg = catch_stop(-1),  % no negative statuses
  602:     ok.
  603: 
  604: catch_stop(Status) ->
  605:     try init:stop(Status) catch error:badarg -> badarg end.
  606: 
  607: %% ------------------------------------------------
  608: %%
  609: %% ------------------------------------------------
  610: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  611:     Args = args(),
  612:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  613:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  614:     ok = rpc:call(Node, init, reboot, []),
  615:     receive
  616: 	{nodedown, Node} ->
  617: 	    ok
  618:     after 10000 ->
  619: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  620: 	    ct:fail(not_stopping)
  621:     end,
  622:     ct:sleep(5000),
  623:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  624: 	pang ->
  625: 	    ok;
  626: 	_ ->
  627: 	    peer:stop(Peer),
  628: 	    ct:fail(system_rebooted)
  629:     end,
  630:     ok.
  631: 
  632: %% ------------------------------------------------
  633: %% 
  634: %% ------------------------------------------------
  635: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  636:     {Start, _} = init:get_status(),
  637: 
  638:     %% Depending on how the test_server is started Start has
  639:     %% different values. staring if test_server started with
  640:     %% -s flag.
  641:     case lists:member(Start, [started, starting]) of
  642: 	true ->
  643: 	    ok;
  644: 	_ ->
  645: 	    ct:fail(get_status)
  646:     end.
  647: 
  648: %% ------------------------------------------------
  649: %% 
  650: %% ------------------------------------------------
  651: script_id(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     {Name, Vsn} = init:script_id(),
  653:     if
  654: 	is_list(Name), is_list(Vsn) ->
  655: 	    ok;
  656: 	true ->
  657: 	    ct:fail(not_standard_script)
  658:     end,
  659:     ok.
  660: 
  661: %% ------------------------------------------------
  662: %% Test that .erlang file works as it should
  663: %% ------------------------------------------------
  664: dot_erlang(Config) ->
  665:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  666: 
  667:     TestHome = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  668:     ok = file:make_dir(TestHome),
  669: 
  670:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  671:                   {win32, _} ->
  672:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  673:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  674:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  675:                   _ ->
  676:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  677:               end,
  678: 
  679:     NodeOpts = #{ env => HomeEnv },
  680: 
  681:     %% Get basedir of peer node
  682:     {ok, CreatorPeer, CreatorNode} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  683:     UserConfig = erpc:call(CreatorNode, filename, basedir, [user_config,"erlang"]),
  684:     peer:stop(CreatorPeer),
  685: 
  686:     XDGErlang = filename:join([UserConfig, ".erlang"]),
  687:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(XDGErlang),
  688:     ok = file:write_file(XDGErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,xdg)."),
  689: 
  690:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  691: 
  692:     ?assertEqual({ok, xdg}, erpc:call(Node, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  693:     peer:stop(Peer),
  694: 
  695:     HomeErlang = filename:join([TestHome, ".erlang"]),
  696:     ok = file:write_file(HomeErlang, "application:set_env(kernel,test,home)."),
  697:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(NodeOpts),
  698: 
  699:     ?assertEqual({ok, home}, erpc:call(Node2, application, get_env, [kernel, test])),
  700:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  701: 
  702:     ok.
  703: 
  704: unknown_module(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  705:     Port = open_port({spawn, "erl -s unknown_module"},
  706:                      [exit_status, use_stdio, stderr_to_stdout]),
  707:     Error = "Error! Failed to load module 'unknown_module' because it cannot be found.",
  708:     [_ | _] = string:find(collect_until_exit_one(Port), Error),
  709:     ok.
  710: 
  711: collect_until_exit_one(Port) ->
  712:     receive
  713:         {Port, {data, Msg}} -> Msg ++ collect_until_exit_one(Port);
  714:         {Port, {exit_status, 1}} -> []
  715:     after
  716:         30_000 -> ct:fail(erl_timeout)
  717:     end.
  718: 
  719: %% ------------------------------------------------
  720: %% Start the slave system with -boot flag.
  721: %% ------------------------------------------------
  722: 
  723: boot1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  724:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", "start_sasl"],
  725:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  726:     peer:stop(Peer),
  727: 
  728:     %% Try to start with non existing boot file.
  729:     Args1 = args() ++ ["-boot", "dummy_script"],
  730:     try
  731:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args1, connection => standard_io}),
  732:         ct:fail({boot1, "started with non existing boot file"})
  733:     catch
  734:         exit:{boot_failed, {exit_status, 1}} ->
  735:             ok
  736:     end.
  737: 
  738: boot2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  739:     %% Absolute boot file name
  740:     Boot = filename:join([code:root_dir(), "bin", "start_sasl"]),
  741: 
  742:     Args = args() ++ ["-boot", Boot],
  743:     {ok, Peer, _Node} = ?CT_PEER(Args),
  744:     peer:stop(Peer),
  745: 
  746:     case os:type() of 
  747: 	{win32, _} ->
  748: 	    %% Absolute boot file name for Windows -- all slashes are
  749: 	    %% converted to backslashes.
  750: 	    Win_boot = lists:map(fun
  751: 				     ($/) -> $\\;
  752: 				     (C) -> C
  753: 				end, Boot),
  754: 	    Args2 = args() ++ ["-boot", Win_boot],
  755: 	    {ok, Peer2, _Node2} = ?CT_PEER(Args2),
  756: 	    peer:stop(Peer2);
  757: 	_ ->
  758: 	    ok
  759:     end,
  760: 
  761:     ok.
  762: 
  763: %% Misc. functions    
  764: 
  765: args() ->
  766:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp",
  767:         "--", "c", "d", "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  768: 
  769: long_args(A) ->
  770:     ["-a", "kalle", "--", "a", "b", "-d", "-b", "hej", "hopp", "--", "c", A,
  771:         "-b", "san", "sa", "-c", "4", "5", "6", "-c", "7", "8", "9"].
  772: 
  773: create_script(Config) ->
  774:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  775:     Name = PrivDir ++ "boot_var_test",
  776:     Apps = application_controller:which_applications(),
  777:     {value,{_,_,KernelVer}} = lists:keysearch(kernel,1,Apps),
  778:     {value,{_,_,StdlibVer}} = lists:keysearch(stdlib,1,Apps),
  779:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Name ++ ".rel", [write]),
  780:     io:format(Fd,
  781: 	      "{release, {\"Test release 3\", \"P2A\"}, \n"
  782: 	      " {erts, \"4.4\"}, \n"
  783: 	      " [{kernel, \"~s\"}, {stdlib, \"~s\"}]}.\n",
  784: 	      [KernelVer,StdlibVer]),
  785:     file:close(Fd),
  786:     {filename:dirname(Name), filename:basename(Name),
  787:      KernelVer, StdlibVer}.
  788:
